thread.title: Chilling video shows grandma celebrating after shooting dead son-in-law and vowing "I would do it again"
thread.title_full: Chilling video shows grandma celebrating after shooting dead son-in-law and vowing "I would do it again"

author: Rachel Bishop
title: Chilling video shows grandma celebrating after shooting dead son-in-law and vowing "I would do it again"
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A grandma demonstrated in chilling detail how she murdered her son-in-law 'after years of abuse.' 
Cynthia Cdebaca, 65, celebrated shooting at Geoward Eustaquio 'until the gun was empty' as she explained to detectives in a police interview. 
Cdebaca, from Fallbrook, California, said she and her son-in-law were arguing the morning of the fatal shooting - but she had planned his murder two weeks before. 
On Thursday jurors were shown the video of Cdebaca admitting the killing on the morning of February 11, 2014. 
Cdebaca said during the video: "I got dressed and he said, 'you can't go like that.' Chilling video shows Cynthia Cdebaca explaining how she killed her son in law (Photo: FOX 5 SAN DIEGO) Cynthia Cdebaca shot her son-in-law Geoward Eustaquio at his home in California (Photo: FOX 5 SAN DIEGO) 
"He told me 'you look ghetto,'. 
She said Eustachio then told her she couldn't go to her granddaughter's spelling bee. 
"I shot him 10 times then he went inside the house and locked the door," said Cdebaca. Read More 
She explained how she shot through the door, entered the home and fired rounds until the gun was empty. Cynthia Cdebaca raises her hands in the air as if she's celebrating (Photo: FOX 5 SAN DIEGO) Cdebaca used a .38-caliber, five-shot revolver to kill Geoward Eustaquio (Photo: FOX 5 SAN DIEGO) 
Cdebaca used a .38-caliber, five-shot revolver â€“ meaning that she needed to reload at least twice, a court heard. 
When the prosecution asked her if she checked on Eustachio afterwards, she replied: "I didn't care. I would do it again." 
She said her family had suffered 13 years of abuse at the hands of Eustaquio, reports aol.com . 
She added: "I told (my daughter) 13 years ago, he's evil." Cdebaca faces 50 years to life in prison if convicted (Photo: FOX 5 SAN DIEGO) 
When investigators pressed her for details of the abuse, Cdebaca did not provide any details. Read More Jilted woman cut off man's penis with a SICKLE and ran down road as he told her he was marrying someone else 
The video showed the emotional moment as each member of Cdebaca's family said goodbye before she was taken into the cells. 
As she left she asked her youngest granddaughter for a hug, but she replied: "No, you killed my dad." 
Cdebaca could face 50 years to life in prison if convicted. 
The trial continues.
